column4: What file does Ubuntu use to mount file automatically? in /etc/fstab I only find my filesystem, but two of my devices are being mounted and I wish to rename where they mount to.
removable drives like usb sticks?
USB drives, yes.
easiest way is to just change their labels.  They'll get mounted to /media/LABEL
I'm aware, that's what I'm trying to change.
umm, changing the label is one command?
sure, just like in the wiki
Well, okay. I'll try it then.
but the wiki answers your question
It mentions a configuration file path?
Because I am not seeing anything but how to use some GUI to configure Synaptics, which is definitely not desired...
wow. be patient.
because I'm trying to reply to you.
Sorry, I assumed you had ignored me.
*sigh* it definitely used to.  Sorry about that.  Anyway, on current ubuntu one can either use xinput or /usr/lib/X11/xorg.conf.d
GaryD: /usr/lib/X11 does not contain an xorg.conf file; This is 10.10 Netbook by the way.
pay close attention to what we wrote :)
in the xorg.conf.d directory there should be some file with synaptics in its name
what version of ubuntu?
/usr/share/X11/xorg.conf.d/ my fault
dpkg -L xserver-xorg-input-synaptics  will list what files the package provides
Alright, but I'm not logged in to Ubuntu at the moment so that'll have to wait. Thanks for the help.
